alert.note: Alert for Carter; Greenup (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 2:26PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Greenup and central Carter Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 225 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Load, or 10 miles north of Carter Caves State Park, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Grayson, Carter Caves State Park, Load, Denton, Gesling, Greenbo Lake, Oldtown, Naples, Carter, Flatwoods, Russell, Bellefonte, Hopewell, Brushart, Hitchins and Warnock. This includes Interstate 64 in Kentucky between mile markers 163 and 180. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
